author: Special Correspondent
text:
Objective is to tap engineering ideas of students for social development

Promoting scientific temper:Students explaining the models to visitors at the science exhibition under way at District Science Centre in Tirunelveli on Thursday.— Photo: A. Shaikmohideen

The three-day techno fair, christened ‘Engineering Tirunelveli 2050’ commenced at District Science Centre here on Thursday.

The DSC, along with Anna University’s Regional Office here, is organising the techno fair, in which innovative projects on development and future of Tirunelveli by engineering and polytechnic students from various parts of Tamil Nadu have been displayed.

The objective of the fair is to tap engineering ideas of students for social development.

The fair was inaugurated by Collector M. Karunakaran, in the presence of K. Baskar, Vice-Chancellor, Manonmaniam Sundaranar University.

Of the 262 projects submitted by students from various colleges across Tamil Nadu, a panel of judges scrutinized and selected 127 projects in Electronics, Mechanical, Civil, Computer Science, Electrical, Environmental and Instrumentation engineering for the final participation.

Three best projects

On Friday (March 4), a panel of judges will select three best projects in each discipline and the winners will be taken to premier institutes like IITs, Anna University and leading industries.

Also, 25 enthusiastic engineering students will be identified by the Techno Fair Committee and sent for the ‘Engineering Ride programme’.

Workshops are underway for engineering students during these days at DSC.
title: Techno fair commences at District Science Centre
